question: Which of the following is NOT a feature of the Constitution of India?
__________Directive principles of State Policy were added to the Indian Constitution by the 42nd Constitutional Amendment Act of 1976.
Which of the following statements is INCORRECT regarding Fundamental Rights?
option_1: Fundamental Rights can be enforced by Law.
option_3: The Fundamental Rights are mentioned in constitution from article 12 to 35.
option_4: Fundamental rights are derived from the Britain Constitution.

question: Who among the following devised the system of 'Subsidiary Alliance'?
Who among the following was the last sultan of Delhi sultanate?
In which of the following Major Rock Edicts of Ashoka is the Kalinga war mentioned?
In which of the following years was VD Savarkar sent to Andaman Jail by the British?
In which year was Project Tiger launched in India?
The Wardha is a tributary of which of the following rivers?
In which state of India is the Chandra Prabha Wildlife Sanctuary located?
The upper portion of the Earth is known as:
Which Five-Year Plan primarily focused on the 'Garibi Hatao' initiative?

Match the concepts in column A with their respective descriptions in column B.
Column A
a. Gross national product
b. Net national product
c. Personal income
d. Disposable personal income
Column B
1. Annual income received by the individual's production in a given period
2. After the tax of personal income
3. Money value of the national output
4. Net production of goods services during the year
Which of the following is an example of joint sector industry?
Which of the following is a correct order of basicity?
Which of the following characteristics is NOT of Aves?
option_2: They give birth to live young ones with some exceptions those lay eggs.

question: What is the unit of measurement for optical power of the lens?
Ernest Rutherford used about _________ thick gold foil for alpha scattering experiments.
Which of the following is NOT a component of a flower?
The head office of Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) is located in
MG Music Awards is presented annually by which of the following states?
Which of the following is an inactivated polio vaccine developed in 1952?
The National Youth Policy 2014 defines youth ______ as ______ the population between the ages of 30 years.

Select the grammatically incorrect sentence.

P. Had the investigator checked all the documents throughly, he would have noticed the discrepancies that were glaringly obvious to others.
Q. If it had not been for his timely intervention, the company could have suffered a far greater financial setback than anticipated 
R. Even though the recommendations seemed promising, neither the suggestions made by the consultants nor the ideas proposed by the board was approved.
S. The board's insistence that every employee fills out the compliance form sparked some backlash.
It is dangerous and harmful to be guided in our life's course by hatreds and aversions, for they are wasteful of energy and limit and twist the mind, and prevent it (to perceiving) the truth.

Select the most appropriate option that can substitute the bracketed part in the given sentence.
The granaries of India are trapped in a dangerous vicious cycle of input use, where increased dumping of fertiliser in the wrong combinations (has rendered) the soil incapable of regenerating itself, which in turn escalates input use.

Fill in the blank with the most suitable word.
He made me think of an old time magician more than ______ .

Select the correct passive form of the given sentence.
I know he will play his guitar.
option_1: His guitar will be played by him is something I know
option_2: It is known to me that his guitar would be played by him
option_3: It is known to me that his guitar will be played by him
option_4: His guitar will be played by him is know to me

question:
Choose the word that can substitute the given group of words.
Affecting all or most people, places, things, etc.

Choose the word that means the same as the given word.
Nascence

Some parts of a paragraph have been jumbled up, and labelled A, B, C and D. Select the option that gives the correct sequence in which these parts can be rearranged to form a meaningful and grammatically correct paragraph.
I clenched my jaw in glee.
(A) I shook my companions awake.
(B) But it was not a time for calmness.
(C) When they saw my face, they feared I'd gone mad.
(D) I knew what I must do. I told them my plan.

Select the correct passive form of the given sentence.
These shoes don't suit this dress.
option_1: This dress isn't suited by these shoes
option_2: These shoes don't suit this dress.
option_3: This dress is not being suited by these shoes.
option_4: These shoes are not suited by this dress.

question: Select the sentences that contain no spelling errors.
option_1: I heard raucouos laughter from the next room
option_2: I heard raocous laughter from the next room
option_3: I heard raucus laughter from the next room
option_4: I heard raucous laughter from the next room

question:
In the given sentence the underlined word may have been incorrectly spelt. Identify the option that rectifies the spelling. If there is no error in spelling, select 'No error'.
Siras-ud-Daula beseiged Calcutta to take punitive actions against the East India Company.

Two sentences with one blank each are given below which require a pair of synonyms to make coherent sense. The options contain pairs of words in their base forms; their part of speech can be changed depending upon the grammatical requirement of the sentence. Choose the correct option accordingly.
(i) Chronic diseases often ____ the capacity to recover from malnutrition.
(ii) While addressing undernutrition, it is essential to identify and ____ the underlying causes to promote long-term health outcomes.

The following sentence has been divided into parts. One of them may contain an error. Select the part that contains the error from the given options. If you don't find any error, mark 'No error' as your answer.
option_1: He explained that the pillars of tribalism
option_2: that humans rely on for security would always
option_3: counter any significant culture or social change

question: The following sentence has been divided into parts. One of them may contain an error. Select the part that contains the error from the given options. If you don't find any error, mark 'No error' as your answer
option_1: Credit when used responsibly, can achieve a great number
option_2: of positive things in our lives, such as
option_3: financing and paying of our dream hybrid or college tuition fees

question:
Direction: In the following passage, some words have been deleted. Read the passage carefully and select the most appropriate option to fill in each blank.              
Slowly but surely the sole of a shoe emerges from a bowl of liquid resin, as Excalibur rose from the enchanted lake. And, just as Excalibur was no ordinary sword, this is no ordinary sole. It is light and flexible with an ____ (1) ____ internal structure, the better to help it support the wearer's foot. Paired with its sole ___(2)___ it will underpin a set of trainers from a new range planned by Adidas, a German sportswear firm Adidas intends to use the 3D printed sales to make trainers at two new, highly automated factories in Germany and America, instead of producing them in the low-cost Asian countries to which most trainer production has been _____(3)_____ in recent years. The firm will thus be able to bring its shoes to market faster and keep up with fashion trends. At the moment, getting a design to the shops can take months. The new factories, each of which is intended to turn out up to 500,000 pairs of trainers a year, should cut that to a week or less. As this example shows, 3Dprinting has come a long way, quickly. In February 2011, when The Economistran a story called "Print me a Stradivarius", the idea of printing objects still seemed extraordinary. Now, it well established. Additive manufacturing, as it is known technically, ____(4)_____ speeding up designs and is also being used to make customised and complex items for actual sale. These range from false teeth, via jewellery, to parts for cars and aircraft. 3D printing is not ___(5)___ Generally. Yet it remains too slow for mass production, too expensive for some applications and for others produces results not up to the required standard. But, as Adidas's soles show, these shortcomings are being dealt with. It is not foolish to believe that 3Dprinting will power the factories of the future. Nor need the technology be restricted to making things out of those industrial stalwarts, metal and plastic. It is also capable of extending manufacturing's reach into matters biological.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank no.1

Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the given word.
Ribald

Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the given word.
CONSTRUE

Select the most appropriate homonym to fill in the blank.
The manager will be angry if you ____ him when he's in conference

Some parts of a paragraph have been jumbled up, and labelled A, B, C and D. Select the option that gives the correct sequence in which these parts can be rearranged to form a meaningful and grammatically correct paragraph.
I clenched my jaw in glee
(A) I shook my companions awake
(B) But it was not a time for calmness
(C) When they saw my face, they feared I'd gone mad 
(D) I knew what I must do. I told them my plan.

Some parts of a paragraph have been jumbled up, and labelled A, B, C and D. Select the option that gives the correct sequence in which these parts can be rearranged to form a meaningful and grammatically correct paragraph.
A. I would attach as many as four of them to a crosspiece, rotably arranged on a thin spindle, and transmit the motion of the same to a large disc and so derive considerable 'power'.
B. In my next attempt I seem to have acted under the first instinctive impulse which later dominated me - to harness the energies of nature to the service of man.
C. These creatures were remarkably efficient, for once they were started they had no sense to top and continued whirling for hours and hours and the hotter it was the harder they worked.
D. I did this through the medium of May-bugs - or June-bugs as they are called in America - which were a veritable pest in that country and sometimes broke the branches of trees by the sheer weight of their bodies.
Select the idiom that does not mean go to bed.

Identify the error in the following sentence and select the option with the correct use of the phrasal verb.
Prateek was planning to ask Shreya for a favour. But he could not muster up the courage. So, he blacked out.
option_1: Prateek was planning to ask Shreya for a favour. But he could not muster up the courage. So, he turned down.
option_2: Prateek was planning to ask Shreya for a favour. But he could not muster up the courage. So, he checked out.
option_3: Prateek was planning to ask Shreya for a favour. But he could not muster up the courage. So, he chickened out.
option_4: Prateek was planning to ask Shreya for a favour. But he could not muster up the courage. So, he broke in.

question:
Select the most appropriate homonyms from the given alternatives to fill in the blanks.
He ______ imitate the playful movement of the ______ .
Alternatives:
A. does (female deer)
B. does
C. dose

The following sentence has been split into four segments. Identify the segment that contains an INCORRECT preposition. 
I am writing to invite you/to give a presentation/for our Jobs and Careers Conference/for engineering graduates.
option_1: I am writing to invite you
option_4: for our Jobs and Careers Conference
